page.title: 02GREAT WITLEY SCHOOL HISTORY
page.content: The first school was founded in{1844 by Queen Adelaide and by{1849}there were 70 pupils and two teachers. In September{1895}the school moved to its present site. This larger building was donated by the second Earl of Dudley. There were now over a hundred pupils, with a headteacher,two assistants and two pupil teachers. In{1906}the school became Great Witley Church of England School. In{1946}Little Witley School was closed and pupils transferred to Great Witley and in{1948}the school became a junior school. A new infant classroom was added in{1955,}and in {1976}three further classrooms were added. With the closure of Shelsley and Shrawley schools in{1977,}Great Witley School increased to 136 on roll with a head and five teachers. In May {1985}the school has 122 children and a head and four teachers.
